definition[0]: the process of treating a broken bone with special medical equipment that pulls it
example[0]: He was in traction  (=receiving this kind of treatment) for weeks after the accident.
definition[1]: the force that prevents something such as a wheel sliding on a surface
example[1]: The tires were bald  (=completely worn) and lost traction on the wet road.
definition[2]: the type of power needed to make a vehicle move, or to pull a heavy load
definition[3]: if a new idea or thing gains traction, it becomes accepted by or popular with more and more people
example[2]: The idea of changing the structure of the school year is gaining traction.
